Annotation_Schema_TAZ_v1.0.TEXT: [s0] Clint: May I ask a stupid question? [s1] Griffin: No, please! [s2] Clint: Is there some significance to ‘boss rush room’? [s3] Griffin: A boss rush is just like a video game thing, like in Mega Man, before you face the final boss, you have to fight all the bosses that you fought so far. [s4] Clint: Right. [s5] Okay. [s6] Justin: That’s good content though, because that’s good for our elderly listeners as well. [s7] Griffin: That’s true! [s8] Justin: All the senior citizens that listen -- [s9] Griffin: [‘elite gamer’ voice, sarcastically with irony] Who’ve never played a fuckin Mega Man game because they’re not ““true elite gamers””. [s10] Travis: [joining in sarcastically] Yeah, they’re newbs, they’re cas-ualls. [s11] Clint: Uh, thank you. [s12] Thank you for the compliment. [s13] Griffin: Dad, you’re such a caz-yullll. [s14] Travis: You’re a caz-u-all. [s15] Griffin: Uh so Cam, with his wand in mouth -- by the way, we need to ret-con: Taako, did you get your wand repaired at some point? [s16] ‘Cause I got a lot of tweets from folks last episode saying you did break your wand in the ogre trial, and the reason we didn’t remember that is because it was a hundred and fifty THOUSAND years ago. [s17] [laughter] [s18] Justin: Yeah, that was, that was in the, uh, novella that was given out as a pre-order bonus. [s19] Griffin: Yeah, there was a novella in which you duct-taped your shit back together. [s20] Travis: [pleased with himself for the joke/Harry Potter reference] With Spell-o-tape! [s21] Justin: I fixed my shit with magic. [s22] Like it’s ludicrous to me that I wouldn’t have fixed it by now. [s23] Clint: Sure. [s24] Justin: C’mon. [s25] Griffin: Cam casts Maximillian's Earthen Grasp. [s26] And because there’s not really any earth in here, a big ol’ hand, bigger than a mage hand, forms out of some of the bodies of the mannequins in the back of the room. [s27] And this hand reaches out and tries to grab--- [s28] [Sound of lots of dice clattering loudly on a table] [s29] Griffin: Whoa, what the fuck was that? [s30] Justin: [laughing] That was just me dumpin’ a bunch of dice on the table. [s31] Griffin: Oh, all right. [s32] Justin: Gettin’ ready to play Dungeons and Dragons! [s33] {3:20} [s34] Griffin: It grabs the meat monster on the right, [sound of dice rolling] and it does grab it for… 12 points of damage! [s35] Which is actually enough to kill it. [s36] So I think this fist just comes in and it squeezes this meat monster into hamburger goo. [s37] Clint: Ewwww. [s38] [makes a gross squishing noise] [s39] Griffin: And then... as a bonus action, Cam opens that hand up just flat-palm, and sends it flying across the room, smashing into the other meat monster, and just kind of swatting it up against the wall. [s40] Justin: I, I too am a Magic Boy and I’ve never had a bonus action in my fuckin’ life. [s41] Like, what’s the story with that? [s42] Travis: Yeah, like he’s really coppin’ all of our swagger, huh? [s43] Griffin: Cam is-- Cam is uninhibited by a bunch of extra weight. [s44] He’s an efficient -- what do you cast spells with? [s45] Your brain? [s46] He is just a streamlined spell casting machine. [s47] Justin: Okay. [s48] Clint: I, I can live with that. [s49] Griffin: Uh, next up is… Mmm-- who was at the bottom of the action? [s50] Magnus! [s51] Travis: Me! [s52] Yeah, I’m gonna step up, and I’m gonna punch Jenkins with Phantom Fist. [s53] Griffin: Okay, just for old time’s sake, or? [s54] [sound of dice rolling] [s55] [Justin giggles] [s56] Travis: Well I’ll tell ya in a second, it’s a-- I rolled… it’s a… 20? [s57] Griffin: Okay! [s58] Travis: Uh, attack. [s59] Griffin: Okay, that is– that is more than sufficient. [s60] Travis: Okay, cool. [s61] D4 [rolls dice] 3. [s62] Plus 4, so that’s 7 damage! [s63] And then I’m gonna push him back into that sphere of tentacles and Della Reeses. [s64] Griffin: Okay, uh, all right, you do so-- [s65] Travis: And while he’s flying back, second action, I’m gonna throw my Chance Lance at him. [s66] Griffin: Wow, shit. [s67] That’s -- okay. [s68] Travis: So 12. [s69] Plus 8 -- or is it the same as Railsplitter? [s70] Griffin: Uh, it’s the same as Railsplitter. [s71] 1d8. [s72] Travis: Okay so, plus nine. [s73] So 21. [s74] Griffin: Okay, yeah that’ll do it. [s75] [Rolls dice] [s76] Travis: 6... plus 5, so 11 damage. [s77] And then I recall it. [s78] Griffin: Okay. [s79] That, uh, that hurts him... a lot. [s80] Next up is Jerkins. [s81] Which is, what I- I guess it autocorrected? [s82] [Clint giggles] I have it saying, in my text document, “Jerkins goes after Magnus who is next” to try to remember the order. [s83] So even my text document is not a fan. [s84] Um, Taako, roll 2d6 cold damage, for Hunger of Hadar. [s85] Justin: Yuppp. [s86] [rolls his dice] That’s a 2. [s87] [rolls again] And a 3. [s88] Griffin: Kay. [s89] Jerkins is lookin’ pretty bad-off. [s90] [pauses dramatically] Merle! [s91] Somethin’ bad happens. [s92] Merle: [apprehensively] Yeah? [s93] Griffin: Della Reese… rears back her angelic arm to stab her magic sword into Jenkins, but ju-- [s94] Clint: This is gonna be great! [s95] Griffin: But riiiight before she makes contact-- [s96] Merle: [quietly and nervously] Yeah? [s97] Griffin: She freezes, and she kinda flickers like a TV losing reception... [s98] [Merle sighs dejectedly] [s99] Griffin: And then disappears. [s100] And, Merle, you’ve cast this spell like countless times-- [s101] Clint: Countless. [s102] Griffin: But you’ve never seen anything like this. [s103] In fact, all these hiccups that your holy powers have been going through all day, you haven’t experienced anything quite like it in all your days of cleric-dom. [s104] {6:34} [s105] Um, Jenkins is going to take a step backwards towards the mannequin pile, out of the sphere of Hadar’s whatever, and he casts [Travis starts laughing] outta Bill Hader’s evil sphere, and he casts Dispel Magic. [s106] And the field of inky black tentacles disappears. [s107] [Justin sighs with disappointment] [s108] Griffin: All three of you notice, at the far edge of the room just behind the mannequin body pile, and sort of adjacent to the door - the exit door to this room - all three of you see - I won’t make you roll a perception check because it’s pretty clear as day - you see a dresser just appear out of nowhere. [s109] And then it quickly disappears, and it’s replaced by a bookshelf. [s110] And then that bookshelf disappears, and then it’s a fireplace, and then it’s a lamp, and then it’s nothing. [s111] And Magnus with your True Sight, you see the Red Robe channelling the black smoke to create those objects over there on the far end of the room. [s112] Taako, you’re up. [s113] Justin: Uhm- [Justin clears his throat] [s114] Griffin: You got a pretty bad-off Jerkins. [s115] All the area of effect spells have been spirited away at this point. [s116] And you got your, the -- well, you don’t know what’s happening but there’s magical objects appearing in the corner of the room. [s117] Justin: Uhhhhmmm, okayyy. [s118] Uh, can I do an arcana check as a free action to see if I have any insight into that? [s119] What’s happening over there..? [s120] Griffin: Yeah, sure! [s121] Justin: [rolls] Uh, that’s a 2! [s122] Haaa! [s123] Griffin: That’s a cool - it’s a nice dresser, you notice that! [s124] Probably full of... wonderful clothes. [s125] But it’s weird that it turned into a bookshelf though. [s126] You’re like, “What? [s127] That’s craaazyyy!” [s128] Justin: [in a monotone] That’s crazy… Uhmm [hums as he thinks] I’m going to um, hit, that fuckin-- [s129] Griffin: Oh, by the way, I forgot to mention this: the room around you, it kinda… it appears like you’re on the Rockport Limited again. [s130] Like, the room around you looks like you’re in a train car battling, and there’s like virtual windows looking out to like the passing countryside, like you’re on a train. [s131] Like, the room is recreating the scenes of these classic battles. [s132] Travis: What a nice treat for the audience! [s133] Justin: Uhh let’s see, I’m going to…hurt Jenkins! [s134] [Griffin starts giggling as Justin struggles] With a magical spell! [s135] Of my own choosing! [s136] ...Of my own… [s137] Travis: Nice! [s138] Griffin: Kay. [s139] Clint: This would be a spell that is magical? [s140] Justin: Yeah, I’m just gonna do - you know what? [s141] I’m not gonna get clever on him. [s142] I’m just gonna hit him with a juicy, juicy, Scorching Ray. [s143] Griffin: Mmkay! [s144] Justin: I gotta make a ranged spell attack for each ray-- [s145] Clint: [singing softly] Are you scorching raayyy… [s146] Justin: --There are three rays of them. [s147] Griffin: [impressed] Oh, that’s fun, Dad! [s148] Travis: That was a good joke, Daddy! [s149] Clint: I’m just bringing back an old one from the past! [s150] Griffin: That’s a classic! [s151] Travis: All right! [s152] Clint: You’re bringing back all the bosses! [s153] [sound of dice rolling] [s154] Griffin: [going along with the joke] That’s a good point, Dad! [s155] Let’s do all our old jokes in this one! [s156] [cackling laughter] [s157] Justin: [overlapping and eventually drowned out by Travis] Especially if they are like-- [s158] Travis: Yeah, let’s make this, this is like our ‘trapped in a room’ episode, y’know, where we all-- [s159] Griffin: --Yeah, this is our “bottle” episode. [s160] Justin: --Yeah, especially if they’re from other podcasts. [s161] That’s ideal. [s162] Griffin: Janitor Morton’s gonna be back at 8AM! [s163] We got a lotta time to kill! [s164] [sound of dice rolling three times] [s165] Justin: 18. [s166] 15. [s167] 18! [s168] Griffin: Remember when Dougie found that dead body? [s169] I think it went a little somethin’ like this! [s170] Justin: 18. [s171] 15. [s172] 18. [s173] Those are the three attacks. [s174] Griffin: All three of those are-- yes. [s175] Justin: Lemme just roll some damage real quick. [s176] [sound of dice rolling repeatedly] [s177] Justin: Uh, 5 for the first ray. [s178] 4 for the second ray. [s179] 8 for the third ray. [s180] Griffin: Yeah, for sure. [s181] Jenkins goes flying backwards as these rays hit him and he is vanquished. [s182] And as he goes down, something happens that hasn’t happened in a while! [s183] And that is-- [s184] Travis: We feel something! [s185] [Justin holds back laughter] [s186] Griffin: He, he drops his wand, and Taako, your Umbra staff turns inside out, and sucks that wand in, and devours it. [s187] And it’s been awhile since you’ve taken down a magic-user like this but, [Justin: Mhm] you remember the Umbra staff is capable of consuming the magic essence of your defeated foes. [s188] So it has a little wand snack [Justin makes Cookie Monster omnomnom noises] And it turns right-side out again. [s189] And you feel… you feel… energised! [s190] Justin: Oooh! [s191] Griffin: You feel like you’ve recovered, which is weird, you haven’t felt that in Wonderland very much, and you have in fact recovered your spell slots. [s192] {11:08} [s193] Justin: [laughing with relief] Ohh hoho, delicious! [s194] Delicious! [s195] Griffin: With that, Jenkins goes flying back, his mannequin sorta falls out of his form and goes flying into the pile in the back of the room. [s196] And that pile transforms, with the help of some of that black smoke, into a massive shape, the biggest shape you’ve seen so far. [s197] It’s about 10 feet tall, and it has sorta a conical shape, and then as it starts to take form, you realise it is the shark tank from your race in the Goldcliff Desert. [s198] And in fact, the screen walls and ceiling around you transform as if to look like the badlands surrounding Goldcliff flying past you. [s199] And you are up against the shark tank. [s200] And, next in the order is Merle! [s201] Clint: Okay! [s202] I’m going to --I can’t heal-- [s203] Griffin: Nope! [s204] Clint: I suck at attacks-- [s205] Griffin: Can’t crow, can’t fly-- [s206] Clint: All right! [s207] Here’s what I’m going to do: I’m going to cast Divination. [s208] Griffin: Okay! [s209] Clint: This puts me in touch with a god or god’s servant, so in this case: Pan. [s210] I get to ask a single question-- [s211] Griffin: [gleefully] Oho this is perfect, thank you. [s212] This is a gift. [s213] Clint: --Concerning a goal, event, or activity... [s214] Griffin: Okay. [s215] Clint: …and I have to get a truthful reply... [s216] Griffin: All right. [s217] Clint: ...from the god. [s218] Griffin: Uh, okay. [s219] Travis: Once again, I love doing this ‘cause I like contextualising what’s going on. [s220] So what’s just happened is this shark tank has appeared and then-- [s221] Griffin: --And then Merle prays. [s222] Travis: --Merle’s just gone “Hold on, one second!” And then just like starts praying. [s223] And everybody just like… holds. [s224] Griffin: Yeah. [s225] Travis: And everyone’s just like, okay. [s226] Clint: I’m of no use as long as my powers aren’t working! [s227] Griffin: Yeeep. [s228] Travis: [holding back laughter] And so to combat that, you use one of your powers! [s229] Griffin: You - you pray--- [s230] Clint: Travis, I am-- Merle is a deeply spiritual character- [Travis busts up laughing] [s231] Griffin: Sometimes. [s232] Clint: -and in times of need, he turns to his god for guidance. [s233] Griffin: Okay. [s234] Hit him up. [s235] Travis: Like any good religious person, when he needs something. [s236] Griffin: Okay, what’s your question. [s237] Merle: [singing] Hellooooo~ PAA-aaaannnn-- [s238] Clint: You want more? [s239] Travis: [overlapping] Oh god, no! [s240] Griffin: Well, I mean, just the question-- [s241] Clint: And I have to get a truthful answer? [s242] Correct? [s243] Griffin: Uh. [s244] Yes. [s245] Clint: Okay. [s246] Merle: What is going on with my holy powers? [s247] Griffin: Here is the truthful response - this is Griffin, not Pan speaking. [s248] [“Pan” plays quietly] Here is the truthful response to your question, Merle: Pan’s not answering. [s249] And it’s not… it’s, you know, beyond a shadow of a doubt, he’s just not... He’s just not there! [s250] And he’s not, he’s… he’s not there supporting you with a holy power, he’s not... He’s just– he’s just gone! [s251] And this is fuckin’ terrifying. [s252] Like you, this spell that you’re casting is essentially like a telephone call of a prayer, and Pan has always answered… but not this time. [s253] He is not there. [s254] Clint: So-- [s255] Griffin: And it’s not like, it’s not, you can tell, it’s not like you’re getting bad reception on your prayer. [s256] You feel it going through, he’s just not- he's just not pickin’ up. [s257] Clint: He’s not there, or he’s not answering? [s258] Griffin: You don’t, you don’t know the answer to that. [s259] But he’s not… he just. [s260] The reason that your spells aren’t working is because they are powered by Pan and right now, Pan is not there for you. [s261] [music fades out] [s262] Clint: So, so I, I get another turn then, right? [s263] [Griffin and Travis laugh] [s264] Griffin: Um, yeah, if you wanna-- yeah, sure. [s265] I think that’s only fair! [s266] Clint: But now my spells are working, just not as well! [s267] Correct? [s268] Griffin: Uhm, they are working less and less well, yes. [s269] Clint: All right, well then while I’ve got a little bit, I’m gonna cast Bless on all three of us. [s270] Griffin: Okay! [s271] What’s that do? [s272] Clint: It is a-- I’m still buffering -- [adopting a radio announcer voice for quickly reading the fine print] “Still Buffering” is a copyrighted feature -- [s273] Travis: [reacting to the reference to Still Buffering] Ah-ah-- ah-ah-- [s274] Griffin: That’s fine. [s277] Clint: It lasts… wow. [s278] Up to a minute! [s279] Griffin: Okay, I mean that’s 10 turns! [s280] So. [s281] Clint: Yeah. [s282] So yeah, so all three of us now can add a d4. [s283] Griffin: A d4, cool. [s284] Clint: Should I roll the d4 now or every time it happens? [s323] And like some sparks shoot out of it. [s324] Um, you see something in the corner of the room again. [s325] You see, um, right where that same sort of collection of stuff appeared before, you see a potted plant appear, and then a guillotine, and then a marble column, and then a coat rack, and then nothing. [s702] Griffin: You can tell that this chamber that you’ve stepped out into is not like the other ones you’ve been in since you’ve been here in Wonderland. [s703] It’s pretty dark in here, but you can tell that this chamber is still circular, but it’s way way bigger than all the rooms you’ve been in so far. [s704] It’s cavernous. [s705] And behind you, you see this massive cylinder. [s706] And it’s what you just stepped out of, but it’s completely featureless, except for a small label on its exterior wall that has your guys’ names on it. [s707] And as you look around, you see there’s a bunch of these different cylinders - 38 of them to be exact - all wrapping around a huge central staircase. [s708] This big round central staircase which climbs 20 feet up to a circular platform at the centre of the chamber. [s878] I don’t know how, but you did it! [s879] Griffin: And Lydia says: [s880] Lydia: Very few people have stood where you’re standing now, having conquered suffering itself to claim their prize. [s881] Give them a hand, folks! [s882] Griffin: And every mannequin just stands up and is, like, giving you a big standing ovation. [s883] And Edward says, uh: [s884] Edward: This resolve, this desire to do whatever it takes no matter the cost to save yourselves -- Do you know who you three remind me of? [s885] Magnus: No? [s886] Merle: Who? [s887] Edward: Us! [s888] Travis: Eugh! [s889] Griffin: You hear Lydia say: {48:50} [s890] Lydia: There were three of us, once, lifetimes ago. [s891] We had another sibling, a younger brother, Keats. [s892] It was the three of us, surviving against all odds. [s893] The world against us. [s894] But Keats– Keats got sick. [s895] And he wouldn’t get better. [s896] So Edward and I joined a necromantic circle to try and save him. [s897] Griffin: And Edward says: [s898] Edward: We were… unsuccessful, but we found joy in our new-found powers. [s899] That’s when we became liches and managed to sustain ourselves with our love for our dear Keats and each other. [s900] But when that became insufficient, we discovered ways of using other people's emotions to sustain ourselves. [s901] Emotion is… so powerful, and practical. [s902] That’s how we discovered that, well, suffering’s much more effective than love. [s903] Griffin: And Lydia says: [s904] Lydia: We’re the oldest living -- well, un-living things in this whole world, I’d reckon. [s905] Here’s a fun fact they don’t tell you about liches: Your spectral form resembles what you looked like when you consigned your soul to lichdom. [s906] That means we have to spend an eternity in the drab, black robes of our circle. [s907] [“The Animus Bell” begins playing] [s908] Griffin: Uh, and Edward says: [s909] Edward: Eventually, we discovered how to channel suffering to create new garments for ourselves -- fantastic garments! [s910] Then we learned how to channel it into other forms. [s911] We could summon small household objects, and then bigger objects, and then finally summoning entire rooms from the ether. [s912] That’s how we came up with Wonderland! [s913] It’s a perfect centrifuge for extracting suffering from those who, fueled by greed, came to visit us.
